tags.description: Run the Connectivity problems scenario to troubleshoot slow download and high response time.
tags.name: Connectivity problems

post.description: Launches an [asynchronous](ref:asynchronous-processes) request to simultaneously run [Launch a GREP request](ref:post-grep), [Request content with cURL](ref:post-curl), and [Test network connectivity with MTR](ref:post-mtr) operations for a URL. It may help you diagnose issues with slow download and high response time. Successful operations return fetched GREP, cURL, and MTR data.

schema.description: Collects data to use in the Connectivity problems scenario request.

clientIp.description: Client IP for the Connectivity problems scenario to start MTR from. You can use the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](ref:get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

edgeLocationId.description: Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to end users experiencing issues with the URL. Run the [List available edge server locations](ref:get-edge-locations) operation to get this value.

ipVersion.description: IP version for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run cURL and MTR commands, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.

packetType.description: Packet type for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.

port.description: Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.

requestHeaders.description: Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes [Akamai Pragma headers](doc:pragma-headers) by default.

runFromSiteShield.description: Runs Connectivity problems from a Site Shield map. To learn more, check [Site Shield requests](ref:site-shield-requests).

sensitiveRequestHeaderKeys.description: Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request. Check [Sensitive headers](ref:sensitive-headers) to see the list of request headers treated as sensitive by default.

spoofEdgeIp.description: IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from. You can use the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](ref:get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

url.description: URL you want to run the Connectivity problems scenario for.

suggestedActions: Check for long times.
Check content length/bytes served.

fObjectStatus.a: This response was sent through the ESI processor.
fObjectStatus.x: Either 'no-store' is turned on by metadata and not disabled by "!no-store" in the response or the downstream TTL was set by metadata and not by the response header.
fObjectStatus.o: The origin server was contacted for the request.

suggestedActions: Compare the response headers served from edge and origin.
Check for content correctness.
Check content length/bytes served.

requestHeaders: Pragma: akamai-x-cache-on, akamai-x-cache-remote-on, akamai-x-check-cacheable, akamai-x-get-true-cache-key, akamai-x-get-cache-key, akamai-x-serial-no, akamai-x-get-request-id

suggestedActions: Look for a packet loss or sudden jumps in the hop time.
For a loss or latency within the end user ISP network, ask the end user to contact thier ISP.
For a loss or latency within Akamai network, contact Akamai Technical Support.
If a packet loss occurs at one hop but does not propogate to the end of the trace, it is irrelevant.

schema.description: Collects the Connectivity problems scenario results and details about the request.

clientIpLocation.description: Specifies the geolocation of the Client IP.

asNumber.description: Autonomous System Number the edge IP maps to.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.

connectivity.description: Lists the results of the MTR request.

ipVersion.description: IP version used by the request, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.

packetType.description: Packet type used by the request, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.

port.description: Port number used by the request, either `80` or `443`.

destinationContext.description: Whether the destination IP is a `CLIENT_IP` or `ORIGIN_IP`.

destinationIpLocation.description: Specifies the geolocation of the origin server IP.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.

errors.description: Collects information about problems occurred while fetching the data.

executionContext.description: Execution context for MTR. Edge Diagnostics executes MTR between an edge server and the origin server (`EDGE_IP_TO_ORIGIN_IP`) or, if a client IP is present in the request, between an edge server and the client machine (`EDGE_IP_TO_CLIENT_IP`).

executionStatus.description: Status of the MTR request's execution. Possible values are `SUCCESS`, `FAILURE`, or `NOT_EXECUTED`. The `info` member and `FAILURE` in `errorResponse` provide details for `NOT_EXECUTED`.

averageLatency.description: Average latency for all hops, in seconds.

hops.description: Lists network hops with their data.

items.description: Collects network hops with their data.

averageLatency.description: Average hop value, useful to detect ongoing problems.

host.description: Host or domain name for the hop.

asNumber.description: Autonomous System Number the edge IP maps to.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.

lastPacketLatency.description: Last measured hop value, useful to detect ongoing problems.

number.description: Index for each hop's count within the full set.

packetLoss.description: Percentage of packets lost for the hop, maximum `100`.

sentPackets.description: Number of packets sent for the hop.

host.description: Hostname within the edge network that corresponds to the `source` IP address.

startTime.description: Epoch timestamp marking when MTR was run.

sourceContext.description: Context for MTR source. The source can be either an edge server forwarding the request to the origin server (`EDGE_IP_CONNECTED_TO_ORIGIN`) or an edge server in the location (`EDGE_IP_BASED_ON_LOCATION`), either selected randomly or provided in the request.

sourceIpLocation.description: Specifies the geolocation of the source IP.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.

executionStatus.description: Status of the MTR request's execution. Possible values are `SUCCESS`, `FAILURE`, or `NOT_EXECUTED`. The `info` member and `FAILURE` in `errorResponse` provide details for `NOT_EXECUTED`.

request.description: Specifies your Connectivity problems scenario request.

clientIp.description: Client IP for the Connectivity problems scenario to start MTR from. You can use the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](ref:get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

edgeLocationId.description: Unique identifier for an edge server location closest to end users experiencing issues with the URL. Run the [List available edge server locations](ref:get-edge-locations) operation to get this value.

ipVersion.description: IP version for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run cURL and MTR commands, either `IPV4` or `IPV6`.

packetType.description: Packet type for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `ICMP` or `TCP`.

port.description: Port number for the Connectivity problems scenario to use to run MTR, either `80` or `443`.

requestHeaders.description: Customized headers for the `curl` request in the format `header: value`. The request includes [Akamai Pragma headers](doc:pragma-headers) by default.

runFromSiteShield.description: Runs Connectivity problems from a Site Shield map. To learn more, check [Site Shield requests](ref:site-shield-requests).

sensitiveRequestHeaderKeys.description: Sensitive `requestHeaders` you don't want to store in the database after running the request. Check [Sensitive headers](ref:sensitive-headers) to see the list of request headers treated as sensitive by default.

spoofEdgeIp.description: IP of the edge server you want to serve traffic from. You can use the `ip` value from the `edgeIps` array in the [collected diagnostic data](ref:get-user-diagnostic-data-group-records).

url.description: URL you want to run the Connectivity problems scenario for.

requestId.description: Unique identifier for the Connectivity problems scenario request. Store this value to run [Get the Connectivity problems scenario response](ref:get-connectivity-problems-request) operation.

retryAfter.description: Number of seconds when the request is estimated to have processed. It occurs only for operations with the `IN_PROGRESS` status.

siteShieldIp.description: If your request specifies `runFromSiteShield` as `true`, then this IP was used to run Connectivity problems.

siteShieldIpLocation.description: Specifies the geolocation of the edge server used to run the operation.

asNumber.description: Autonomous System Number the edge IP maps to.

city.description: Closest city within a 50-mile radius the edge IP maps to.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 country code the edge IP maps to.

regionCode.description: ISO 3166 region code the edge IP maps to.
